ca.ualberta.cs.shinyexpensetracker.utilities

Class GlobalDateFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.shinyexpensetracker.utilities.GlobalDateFormat

  • public final class GlobalDateFormat
extends Object
    Global date format singleton. This should be used instead of creating new SimpleDateFormatters to keep the format consistent across the app. Example: GlobalDateFormat.toString(new Date()); GlobalDateFormat.toDate("Mar 4, 2015");

    • Method Detail

      • setFormat

        public static void setFormat(String template)
        Sets the global format to the given template Warning: May cause problems with parsing. Locale defaults to Canada.
        Parameters:
        template - The format to use across the app

      • setFormat

        public static void setFormat(String template,
                             Locale locale)
        Sets the format to a given template with a given locale
        Parameters:
        template - The format to use across the app
        locale - The locale, usually the same as the app's

      • parse

        public static Date parse(String dateString)
                  throws ParseException
        Converts a string to a date using the global format. May throw ParseExceptions if the format changes.
        Parameters:
        dateString - String to parse, matching the global format
        Returns:
        The parsed date
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • format

        public static String format(Date date)
        Convert a date object into a String.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to convert
        Returns:
        The formatted string

      • getFormatter

        public static SimpleDateFormat getFormatter()
        Gets the current date formatter. If the global format changes, local instances are preserved.
        Returns:
        The current date format in the system.
